ygData.subject: Re: LD & items lost
ygData.msgSnippet: no thanks to those bags then... think i prefer the old backpack im carrying... :) ... From: LKW  To:  Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
no thanks to those bags then... think i prefer the old backpack im
carrying... :)

----- Original Message -----
From: LKW <leekw13@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, July 09, 1999 2:26 PM
Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] LD & items lost


> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>
> 1. It's a magi summoned bag tat disappears when u logout or LD (link
dead),
> and anything inside will diappear too when the bag vanish.
>
> 2. U r lucky that u havent encounter LD yet, but sooner or later u will
get
> it.
>
> 3. Just an example how how LD hurts:
> a. Tat day I show YY the ring, earring and brac that Kell sold to me.
> After YY finished examing them I cancel the trade window. Since I have 7
> bags and the last slot is filled with something, the jewelry all drop into
> my 1st bag. Fair enough, I open the 1st bag and re-equip them. I put on
> the 1st ring, and kena LD b4 I put on the 2nd piece of jewelry. DOH, when
> I try to relogin, I get the error msg "Zone not available". When I
restart
> my PC and login, I noticed I was timewarpped abit and all the 3 jewelry r
> gone, including the ring tat I've already equip on my char! According to
> Garren, he also kena LD and unable to login immediately due to the same
> error msg at that time. H/w, only me kena the item lost. Call GM and
none
> reply, as usual. ;(
> b. Another time I was hunting wisps at WC. Suddenly an adult kod spawn
> when my mana is only 1/3 left. I fight till OOM and decided to flee to
> zone. While running, I LD. Re-login and find myself naked, so it mean I
> was killed when LD. Nmind, that's not the worst part. I try to find my
> corpse where I last LD but cannot find! I cant be missing the place as
> it's pretty near zone and I'm quite familiar with the place. No choice
> have to shout for help. A dwarven cleric who know me since newbie come to
> help me by lenting me the wand tat point to my corpse. Funny thing is
that
> my corpse lied pretty far from where I last died. According to me dwarven
> friend, it's a bug. When u run and LD, sometime ya body 'continue' to fly
> after u LD and that's why my corpse was found quite a distance from where
I
> last remembered.
> c. Last night I was soloing at HH. Killed an white orc (obvious xp rise),
> found a ring cape and happily go near zone and med. Suddenly LD and when
I
> login, the ring cape is gone and my xp return to b4 I kill the orc. The
> only thing good is tat when I LD, I left less than 50% HP and oom, when I
> relogin I'm full, just like the stats b4 I hunt the orc, sigh.
>
> So another problem with soloing is that if u LD, no one will know or can
> take care of u.
>
> Zil
>
>
> On Friday, 09 July, 1999 12:29 PM, Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy
> [SMTP:sccheng@...] wrote:
> > From: "Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy" <sccheng@...>
> >
> > where the hell did u managed to find em? from some creature? or u buy
> from
> > other players? maybe u can get me some 1-2... when u come over to
> > freeport... :) sounds useful... since i have yet to get disconnected
from
> > the eq server...
> >
> > Nic
> > p/s : dont listen to em saying u can get 10pp in 10 mins... dont get ya
> > hopes too high... i would say 10-20pp in 1 hour is reasonable... n more
> if u
> > r fast... still good money fer a starter...
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Synzzz <hannibal@...>
> > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Friday, July 09, 1999 1:17 PM
> > Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Welcome Linolas and I need Money!!!
> >
> >
> > > From: "Synzzz" <hannibal@...>
> > >
> > > Only way i see it is to use Dimensional Pocket...but that comes not at
> the
> > > start unless someone passes
> > > summoned ones to you. Also they are summoned and the risks associated
> with
> > > summoned items
> > > is there...like disappear when log-off...or sometmies even when you
> kena
> > > disconnected by the damn
> > > EQ server %$&^(%^@#!$...i never put impt things in my Dimensional
> > > Pockets...only those heavy loot.
> > > Great thing is each pocket has 4 slots and everything in those pockets
> > have
> > > no weight at all. YAY~~~
> > >
> > > p.s I usually run around with one backpack and 7 dimensional pockets.
> > >
> > > Zanderion (mage of the 12th moon)
> > >
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > > Sent: Friday, July 09, 1999 9:39 AM
> > > Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Welcome Linolas and I need Money!!!
> > >
> > >
> > > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > >
> > > > Actually I ever thot of making human char b4, thou their stats sux
> and
> > > have
> > > > no infravision, but they can pump up their INT further via artifact,
> > which
> > > > will not lose out too much. Plus the fact that they lvl pretty
fast.
> > > > Maybe it's time for me to make a human caster and ask Kellendil to
> make
> > > > all INT rings, earrings and brac for me and see if can power play
> abit,
> > > > hehe.
> > > >
> > > > Erudite caster life can be damn hard in the begining, esp when they
r
> > > still
> > > > in their town. But at later stage, their high INT make them one of
> the
> > > > better casters ard. Btw, I dun think any caster on this list is
> putting
> > > > stats point like I did when creating char (I put pump my STR to
75!).
> > But
> > > > even at 75 STR, I can get overload very fast. How u guys cope with
> this
> > > > problem? (ok I admit I loot everything to sell, no choice lah, poor
> > mah).
> > > >
> > > > Zil
> > > >
> > > > On Thursday, 08 July, 1999 9:21 PM, Sereph
> [SMTP:garford@...]
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > From: Sereph <garford@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Anything is better than a human mage, just don't play them. You'll
> > > > regretted it
> > > > > pass 10
> > > > >
> > > > > Chow Kah Mun wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > > From: Chow Kah Mun <carmon@...>
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Dun Tell me High-Elf Magi or a Erudite Magi ?
> > > > > >
> > > > > > RuneWeaver
